Assets Stack (web assets management)

Nowadays, in our web apps, we need to deal with :

  • a lot of assets
  • multiple usages on one page
  • assets with parameters
  • generated assets
  • dependencies between assets
  • multiple locations for an assets
  • upgrade asset versions
  • and more…

Dandelion offers the opportunity to build a structured assets stack and let you deal with all your web assets with less pain!


Assets stacks

You can view your assets stack as a set of nested boxes where each of them contain a set of assets.

Scopes and assets

The belowing stack shows us the assets distributions under nested boxes called scope. A scope has a parent scope, can have multiple children and is managed through a Scopes Hierarchy.

For example, the assets stack proposed by Dandelion-Datatables can be viewed as follows:

In this example, the DataTables scope has jQuery as a parent scope. Those scopes contain :

  • 2 assets for DataTables (JS and CSS files),
  • 1 asset for jQuery (JS file).

When you want all assets for use DataTables in a web page :

  • Without your assets stack, you need to include the 3 assets in a particular order (jQuery before DataTables).
  • With your assets stack, you just need to use the scope DataTables.
Stack management
Scopes Hierachy


All nested boxes represent a Scopes Hierarchy.

To build your own assets stack, you have 2 entry points on the scopes hierachy:

  • the Default Scope Parent (default) to build or complete an assets stack,
  • the Detached Scope Parent (none) to build a standalone assets stack.
Assets override

To facilitate the stack management, you can use some override properties. Those properties are useful if your stack is not entirely under your control (modules, libs).

For example, the assets stack proposed by Dandelion-DataTables is:

But you need jQuery in v1.9.1 and DataTables in v1.9.4, you need to override jQuery and DataTables assets.

Here is a list of stuff you can override :

  • an asset of the same scope,
  • an asset in a child scope,
  • the location of an asset by addition,
  • the location of an asset by update.
Usage

You can access your assets stack at any time with the Assets Accessor.

During page rendering, you can manage your assets context with the Assets Request Context helper or directly in your page (jsp or html).

Some samples are available in the Dandelion Samples Repository.

Advanced
Configuration points

You have several configuration points available to help you to organize your assets stack.

Plumbing

Your assets stack is internally :

  • stored in an Assets Storage,
  • managed by an Assets Configurator,
  • loaded by the configured Assets Loaders.

Asset locations can be configured using wrappers. We already provide some wrappers but you can of course write your own!
